definition: angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale

sentences.english: A man was sitting at a corner, with a hat in each hand, waiting for handouts.
sentences.chinese: 一個人坐在牆角處，兩手各託一頂帽子，乞求施捨。

sentences.english: It was in a corner that he lay, among weeds and nettles .
sentences.chinese: 它現在是躺在一個生滿了荊棘和荒草的牆角邊。

sentences.english: The chair-cushion in the corner burst with laughter when she saw it.
sentences.chinese: 牆角里的那個舊椅套子也裂開來看它跳舞。

sentences.english: The mouse squeaked in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 牆角處有老鼠的吱吱聲。

sentences.english: Isshiki Shimizu red brick, corner decorative patterns highlighted.
sentences.chinese: 一色清水紅磚，牆角裝飾花紋凸現。

sentences.english: The light came from a taper which was burning in one corner.
sentences.chinese: 光是從牆角上的一盞油燈裏發出來的。

sentences.english: Waxing quality of the corner area shall as same as the center area – brilliant and dazzling.
sentences.chinese: 牆角上蠟質量與地面中心位置一樣閃亮。

sentences.english: She stacked all the books in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 她把所有的書都堆在了牆角。

sentences.english: Books covered the tables and were piled up on the floor. A simple wooden bed stood in a corner.
sentences.chinese: 桌上和地板上都堆滿了書，牆角是一張簡單的木牀。

sentences.english: But it was their choice to stand in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 不過，去牆角罰站是他們自己選擇的。

sentences.english: A classic example is the way that shadows 'hug' the corners of rooms.
sentences.chinese: 一個經典的例子就是牆角處陰影的樣子。

sentences.english: There, in front of the door, young men mounted on the stone corner-posts, distributed arms.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏，有些青年立在大門前的牆角石上分發武器。

sentences.english: And he advanced on the tips of his boots towards the corner which Marius had turned.
sentences.chinese: 他踮起長統靴的腳尖朝着馬呂斯拐彎的那個牆角走去。

sentences.english: When you're reduced to 10-men here on this pitch then you're up against it.
sentences.chinese: 在這塊場地減員到10人，那就是被逼到牆角。

sentences.english: They peeped out stealthily from a corner of the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他們幾個在牆角處鬼頭鬼腦地往外探望。

sentences.english: A chair at the corner is inclining your words.
sentences.chinese: 牆角的一個坐椅，傾斜着你的話語。

definition: quilt wrapped around the body as a tube (traditional bedding)/(contemporary) bedding/quilt/blankets/cover/bed
to put one's hands behind one's head, fingers interlaced/to hold one's head in one's hands (in dismay, fright etc)/to cover one's head with one's hands (for protection)
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
